New Haven is currently in the process of updating their zoning regulations to incorporate density based zoning and density bonuses for affordable housing. I was told by their zoning administrator that one of their greatest barriers to higher density affordable housing is the lack of sewer and water service to the town.
Hancock has no zoning regulations, only a flood hazard overlay layer. They have no zoning administrator, but town clerk Jody Jesso can be reached at 802-767-3660.

Middlebury may have more overlay layers than listed, but the regulations are a little tricky to parse. The VT Open geodata portal lists a Source Protection Overlay District that is not mentioned in the regulations, and the regulations reference special provisions for development adjacent to Route 7, wetlands, riparian areas, farms, wildlife habitats, and scenic views that are not specifically designated as overlays.
